abstract.p: Lars von Trier film Dancer in the Dark will open 38th New York Film Festival on Sept 22 (S)

block.p: Lars von Trier's ''Dancer in the Dark'' will open the 38th New York Film Festival on Sept. 22.

The film, which stars the pop artist Bjork, won the Palme d'Or at the Cannes International Film Festival this year. Mr. von Trier's previous films include ''Breaking the Waves'' and ''The Idiots,'' as well as the television series ''The Kingdom I'' and ''The Kingdom II.''
Lars von Trier's ''Dancer in the Dark'' will open the 38th New York Film Festival on Sept. 22.

The film, which stars the pop artist Bjork, won the Palme d'Or at the Cannes International Film Festival this year. Mr. von Trier's previous films include ''Breaking the Waves'' and ''The Idiots,'' as well as the television series ''The Kingdom I'' and ''The Kingdom II.''

Starring Catherine Deneuve and David Morse, ''Dancer in the Dark'' tells of a single mother who is losing her eyesight and is determined to save her young son from her fate. A Czech immigrant in a rural American town, she finds salvation and hope in her passion for music.
Presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center, the festival continues through Oct. 9.
